overview:
Barry is a software engineer, entrepreneur, team leader and inventor of software applications for millions of users in several different markets. He is a two time winner of Chris Shipley’s DemoGod award and the inventor of the revolutionary Reality Fusion video interaction technology, which Guy Kawasaki called â€œthe best demo he had ever seen.â€ Reality Fusion distributed over 6m products on the first generation web cams.

Barry started programming computers in 1972 on a DEC PDP-10, worked at Raytheon and Commercial Union Insurance, and then was an early employee at Lotus Development Corporation. He architected for Lotus 1-2-3 and Lotus Symphony, and then left for Borland where he developed the “guts” for Quattro Pro for Windows.

Since 1997, Barry has created five award-winning Internet conferencing services including SeeSaw, the first video chat site on the Internet; TeamView, CameraCafe, VidiTel and Festoon. He also developed the RTCX (Real Time Communications Exchange) architecture for multimedia web conferencing, which was sold by Santa Cruz Networks and became the foundation for a variety of other services such as CloudMeeting. With that as his background, Zorap is next for this serial entrepreneur.
